conversation.text: "Wetness" is defined as a liquid's ability to maintain contact with a solid surface.
conversation.speaker: right

conversation.text: Which would mean that water itself isn't wet.
conversation.speaker: right

conversation.text: So wouldn't that mean that water is dry?
conversation.speaker: left

conversation.text: Because that doen't sit right with me
conversation.speaker: left

conversation.text: Dryness is the absence of a liquid.
conversation.speaker: right

conversation.text: So it's best to believe that liquids can neither be wet, nor dry
conversation.speaker: right
